properties.areaDesc: Vermilion; De Witt; Champaign; Edgar; Douglas; Piatt; McLean
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 12 at 11:19AM CST until February 13 at 10:00AM CST by NWS Lincoln IL
properties.description:
...SNOW TO SPREAD ACROSS AREAS NORTH OF I-70 THIS AFTERNOON INTO
MID THURSDAY MORNING...

.Precipitation will continue to lift northward and overspread
much of central Illinois through the afternoon, with rain
possibly mixed with sleet south of I-70. Areas north of Interstate 70
should start as a mix of precipitation, and then turn to all snow
by later this afternoon and early evening. Snow will continue
tonight and diminish during mid to late Thursday morning, with
snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with locally 4 to 5 inch
amounts possible. Much colder air will move into the area later
tonight into Thursday with some blowing and drifting snow possible
especially in open rural areas.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5
inches.

* WHERE...Portions of central and east central Illinois.

* WHEN...Today to 10 AM CST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions will impact the evening commute, with some
lingering slippery conditions and patchy blowing snow for the
Thursday morning commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for Illinois can be obtained on the
Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CST THURSDAY
